description: Reference security policy aligned with ISO/IEC 27001:2022 Annex A controls for vulnerability management

iso27001_controls.title: Policies for information security
iso27001_controls.objective: To provide management direction and support for information security
iso27001_controls.description: Information security policies shall be defined, approved by management, published, communicated to and acknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals and if significant changes occur.
iso27001_controls.implementation_guidance: Develop and maintain comprehensive information security policies covering vulnerability management, incident response, access control, and compliance. Ensure policies are reviewed annually and updated as needed. Obtain executive approval and communicate to all stakeholders.
iso27001_controls.verification: Policy documents approved and published, annual review records, employee acknowledgment receipts

iso27001_controls.title: Information security in project management
iso27001_controls.objective: To integrate information security into project management
iso27001_controls.description: Information security shall be integrated into project management.
iso27001_controls.implementation_guidance: Include security requirements in all project phases. Conduct security reviews during design, development, and deployment. Ensure DevSecOps practices are followed with security gates in CI/CD pipeline.
iso27001_controls.verification: Project security review records, DevSecOps pipeline configuration, security gate reports

iso27001_controls.title: Privileged access rights
iso27001_controls.objective: To limit the allocation and use of privileged access rights
iso27001_controls.description: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and managed.
iso27001_controls.implementation_guidance: Implement least privilege principle. Use just-in-time (JIT) access for administrative tasks. Log and monitor all privileged access. Conduct quarterly access reviews. Require MFA for all privileged accounts.
iso27001_controls.verification: Privileged access logs, quarterly access review reports, MFA enforcement status

iso27001_controls.title: Management of technical vulnerabilities
iso27001_controls.objective: To prevent exploitation of technical vulnerabilities
iso27001_controls.description: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems in use shall be obtained, the organization's exposure to such vulnerabilities shall be evaluated and appropriate measures shall be taken.
iso27001_controls.implementation_guidance: Establish vulnerability management program with defined processes for identification, assessment, prioritization, remediation, and verification. Use automated scanning tools (SAST, SCA, DAST, container scanning). Maintain vulnerability database with CVSS scoring. Define remediation SLAs based on severity.
iso27001_controls.verification: Vulnerability scan reports, remediation tracking metrics, SLA compliance reports

iso27001_controls.title: Configuration management
iso27001_controls.objective: To ensure security of configuration information
iso27001_controls.description: Configurations, including security configurations, of hardware, software, services and networks shall be established, documented, implemented, monitored and reviewed.
iso27001_controls.implementation_guidance: Implement configuration management database (CMDB). Use infrastructure as code (IaC) with version control. Establish security baselines for all systems. Conduct configuration audits quarterly. Automate configuration compliance checking.
iso27001_controls.verification: CMDB records, IaC repository, baseline documents, compliance scan reports

iso27001_controls.title: Monitoring activities
iso27001_controls.objective: To detect anomalous behavior and cybersecurity events
iso27001_controls.description: Networks, systems and applications shall be monitored for anomalous behavior and appropriate actions taken to evaluate potential information security incidents.
iso27001_controls.implementation_guidance: Deploy SIEM for centralized log collection and analysis. Implement continuous monitoring for security events. Set up alerts for suspicious activities. Maintain 90-day log retention minimum. Conduct weekly log reviews.
iso27001_controls.verification: SIEM configuration, monitoring dashboards, alert logs, weekly review reports

iso27001_controls.title: Installation of software on operational systems
iso27001_controls.objective: To control software installation and minimize security risks
iso27001_controls.description: Procedures and measures shall be implemented to securely manage software installation on operational systems.
iso27001_controls.implementation_guidance: Require approval for all software installations. Maintain approved software whitelist. Scan all software for vulnerabilities before deployment. Use application control to prevent unauthorized software. Conduct monthly software inventory audits.
iso27001_controls.verification: Software approval records, whitelist documentation, installation logs, inventory reports

iso27001_controls.title: Web filtering
iso27001_controls.objective: To manage access to external websites
iso27001_controls.description: Access to external websites shall be managed to reduce exposure to malicious content.
iso27001_controls.implementation_guidance: Deploy web filtering solution with categorization. Block access to malicious and high-risk categories. Monitor and log web access. Update block lists weekly based on threat intelligence. Allow exceptions through formal approval process.
iso27001_controls.verification: Web filter configuration, blocked category lists, access logs, exception approvals

iso27001_controls.title: Use of cryptography
iso27001_controls.objective: To ensure proper and effective use of cryptography
iso27001_controls.description: Rules for the effective use of cryptography, including cryptographic key management, shall be defined and implemented.
iso27001_controls.implementation_guidance: Implement TLS 1.3 for all data in transit. Use AES-256 for data at rest. Establish key management procedures with HSM for sensitive keys. Rotate encryption keys annually. Use only approved cryptographic algorithms.
iso27001_controls.verification: Encryption standards documentation, key management procedures, TLS configuration, rotation logs

iso27001_controls.title: Secure coding
iso27001_controls.objective: To ensure security of application development
iso27001_controls.description: Secure coding principles shall be applied to software development.
iso27001_controls.implementation_guidance: Adopt OWASP Top 10 secure coding practices. Conduct code reviews with security focus. Use SAST tools in IDE and CI/CD. Provide secure coding training to developers annually. Enforce code signing for all production deployments.
iso27001_controls.verification: Secure coding standards, code review records, SAST reports, training completion records

iso27001_controls.title: Change management
iso27001_controls.objective: To ensure security during changes to systems
iso27001_controls.description: Changes to information processing facilities and information systems shall be subject to change management procedures.
iso27001_controls.implementation_guidance: Require security review for all changes. Implement change advisory board (CAB) with security representation. Test all changes in non-production environment first. Maintain rollback procedures. Document all changes in change management system.
iso27001_controls.verification: Change records, CAB meeting minutes, test results, rollback documentation

nist_csf_recommendations.description: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented
nist_csf_recommendations.implementation: Conduct regular vulnerability assessments aligned with ISO 27001 A.8.8 requirements

nist_csf_recommendations.description: A vulnerability management plan is developed and implemented
nist_csf_recommendations.implementation: Establish formal vulnerability management program per ISO 27001 A.8.8
Execute continuous vulnerability scanning with monitoring per ISO 27001 A.8.16

remediation_priorities.reasoning: Critical vulnerabilities with CVSS >= 9.0 must be addressed immediately to prevent exploitation
High-severity vulnerabilities (CVSS 7.0-8.9) require prompt attention to mitigate risk
Medium vulnerabilities (CVSS 4.0-6.9) should be remediated within standard change windows
Low-severity issues (CVSS < 4.0) can be addressed during regular maintenance cycles
